Organizations and Producer Codes

Lesson
objectives

« Manage Organizations

Manage Producer Codes

Describe producers and Producer Code
security

Describe external user access

Marcus
Business
Analyst

How does PolicyCenter organize users from
multiple agencies?

| Organization / Community model G

An organization is a business entity which represents either the insurer or an agency

Insurer Agency
(internal organization) (external organization)

ee se aay
Groups ee ee PCN asx Groups
ofusers esp@an 6a Om se i Se © of producers
~~) ~) gee ig

Producer ] Producer
<>

User @& oo1 @& oo2 code lig oo1 oN oo2 code

| Producer

ae iE

Insurer Producer Insured

« Anintermediary who assists the insurers to underwrite policies for the insureds
¢ Typically, paid commissions for underwritten policies

¢ Identified by a unique producer code

| Internal and external producers Gi

¢ Internal producers are employees of the insurer

* Sell insurance for insurer
* Definition may vary depending upon country or insurer

¢ External producers usually belong to an external
agency or organization

* Some external producers are also called independent
agents

| Producer types

¢ Producer of Record

« Producer that created the submission

« Receives commission based on the
premium

¢ Producer of Service
* Producer that services the policy
« Usually the same as the producer of record

+ If different, then receives commission only
after the policy is renewed

¢ Displayed on Policy Info and Summary
pages

Producer of Record
Organization
Producer Code
Producer of Service

Organization

Producer Code

Gi

Armstrong and Company

100-002541 Armstrong (Premier)

Armstrong and Company

100-002541 Armstrong (Premier)

| Producer code i

¢ Aunique ID assigned by the insurer to track which agent or agency is responsible
for which policies and accounts

* Can track different policy categories for the same producer

Code 100-002541

Description Armstrong (Premier)

Organization Armstrong and Company

Marci
Configuration
Developer

How do | work with organizations and
a producer codes?

| Managing organizations Gi
¢ Search, view, edit and create the organizations from the Administration tab

¢ The tree structure of an organization is displayed in the left sidebar

* Organization details can be viewed and edited in different cards

Actions : Organization: Armstrong and Company

| Basics | Users | Producer Codes | Queues | Regions |

Organization Name Armstrong and Company
Type Agency
Agency Status Active

Tier

| Managing producer code fa

* Search the producer code

¢ Administration > Users & Security > Producer Codes
¢ View or edit the producer code

* The producer code details are on the Basic tab

« Roles can be assigned on the Roles tab

* Groups and Users tabs are available in view mode only

+ Use the Edit Users or Edit Groups administration screens to add producer codes to Groups and Users

* Create a new producer code

« Administration > Actions > New Producer Code

| Review: Producer codes in a group fa

Any user (internal or external) assigned to the group has access to all producer
codes available to the group

Producer Codes tab lists all producer codes assigned to the group

Group: Eastern Mid-West Region

Producer codes can be selected here from those available to the parent group

Available Code Description Status Branch
QALPRODUCERCODEO1 Internal Producer Code-2 Active Los Angeles Branch UW

Standard Code Internal Producer Code-1 Active Los Angeles Branch UW

| Delegate management using User Admin role fa

¢ Internal organizations delegate the management of external companies
* By assigning the User Admin role to a user within that external company

« User admin builds Users, Groups, Organizations and Permissions to represent an external
company

« User admin and other users in the external company do not have access to other
organizations

¢ Internal organization has access and administrative rights to the external company

| Demonstration G

Managing organizations and producer
— codes

click here

Note: The demonstration opens a new tab in your browser. When the demonstration ends, the
original course launch window appears. Return to this window to continue this presentation.

Gi

Marcus
Business
Analyst

| have a requirement to control data access for
producers. How can | do it?

Julia
Implementation

You can use producer code Architect
security, which allows some ee)
users to access a set of accounts
and policies while restricting
access for others.

| Security in PolicyCenter

¢ Role-based security
* A permission is the ability to see or do a granular task
+ Examples: create submission, edit account

« Arole is anamed collection of permissions and typically
maps to a job function or job title

+ Examples: Underwriter, Producer, Auditor

¢ Data-based security

* Defines what data can be accessed and typically managed
through producer codes

« Examples: Policy and Account access is restricted using
producer code security

A ®

O01
00c

| Producer code security G

The producer code controls data access and works with the permissions to
determine what actions can be taken by the user.

User with matching
producer code

| Status field

¢ Is available for both Organizations and Producer Codes
¢ Limits access for an agency whose contract has expired

¢ Prevents producer code misuse

Producer code status
(Suspended, Terminating, Terminated)

| Demonstration G

Producer code security

click here

Note: The demonstration opens a new tab in your browser. When the demonstration ends, the
original course launch window appears. Return to this window to continue this presentation.

Marci |

Configuration Yas

Developer _.

oy

_ How do | configure producer code security?

A)

User Access

¢ Turn on/off producer code security (Yes for user type Producer)

¢ User inherits producer code from their group and can add additional producer

codes

| work on policies for more than one agency
and need to be assigned to groups and
producer codes from more than one
organization.

Julia
Implementation We
Architect

This can be easily done with
External User Access
configuration.

bt

| External user access G&G

¢ Enables producer code security for agents working for multiple agencies

« External users can be assigned to groups and producer codes at three levels

FULLYRESTRICTED PROTECTINTERNAL ALLOWINTERNAL
only within their from any external from internal or any
organization organizations external organizations

|-—_

Agency 1 Agency 2 Insurer

| Demonstration G

External user access (optional)

click here

Note: The demonstration opens a new tab in your browser. When the demonstration ends, the
original course launch window appears. Return to this window to continue this presentation.

Question

_~ — What is a producer code? What does it identify?

4
¢
¢

Sooo oooe sooo oOo oOo oAaDS

Answer

,~ — What is a producer code? What does it identify?

¢
¢
¢

A producer code is a unique ID (alphanumeric) assigned by the insurer to determine
what a producer can do. Producer code and its description identify the sales agent that
sold the policy.

Sooo ooo ooo Oooo oOoD

Question

_~ — Whatis an organization?
4

¢
¢

Sooo oooe sooo oOo oOo oAaDS

Answer

ae What is an organization?

¢
¢

An organization is a business entity which represents either the Insurer itself or an
external company for any set of users, typically producers.

Sooo ooo ooo Oooo oOoD

Question

Which External User Access level allows the external users to be

/’ assigned to groups and producer codes from intemal and any extemal
¢ organization?

Sooo oooe sooo oOo oOo oAaDS

A.
B.
C.
D

. None of the above

FULLYRESTRICTED
PROTECTINTERNAL
ALLOWINTERNAL

Gi

Answer a

Which External User Access level allows the external users to be
assigned to groups and producer codes from intemal and any external
: organization?

FULLYRESTRICTED

PROTECTINTERNAL

ALLOWINTERNAL

None of the above

GOD >

Correct answer: C

Sooo ooo ooo Oooo oOoD
